title: Secret Service director Kimberly Cheatle resigns under fire over Trump shooting
content: US Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle has tendered her resignation coming under fire over the recent assassination attempt of former President Donald Trump, CNN reported. The move came a day after lawmakers grilled her over the agency's handling of Trump's protection at the Pennsylvania rally where a shooter fired at Trump.
summary: US Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle has tendered her resignation coming under fire over the recent assassination attempt of former President Donald Trump, CNN reported. The move came a day after lawmakers grilled her over the agency's handling of Trump's protection at the Pennsylvania rally where a shooter fired at Trump.

title: July 21 recorded as hottest day, breaks previous records
content: On Sunday, July 21, a record 17.09°C was reached, exceeding July 2023’s 17.08°C. Copernicus reported 13 months of rising temperatures. Heatwaves hit the U.S., Russia, and Europe due to climate change, El Nino (ending in April), and fossil fuels. Reuters suggested 2024 might be hotter. In 2022, records were set for four consecutive days.
summary: On Sunday, July 21, a record 17.09°C was reached, exceeding July 2023’s 17.08°C. Copernicus reported 13 months of rising temperatures. Heatwaves hit the U.S., Russia, and Europe due to climate change, El Nino (ending in April), and fossil fuels. Reuters suggested 2024 might be hotter. In 2022, records were set for four consecutive days.

title: Dubai princess Sheikha Mara's first post after divorcing husband on Instagram
content: ​Dubai princess Sheikha Mahra bint Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum who divorced her husband on Instagram posted a photo with her two-month old daughter after making headlines for her divorce. The princess and her two-month-old have been captured in front of a portrait of a horse. The princess did not write any caption but posted a white heart symbol.
summary: ​Dubai princess Sheikha Mahra bint Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum who divorced her husband on Instagram posted a photo with her two-month old daughter after making headlines for her divorce. The princess and her two-month-old have been captured in front of a portrait of a horse. The princess did not write any caption but posted a white heart symbol.

title: Wildfires near Canada's Jasper National Park prompt evacuation; fleeing vehicles clog highways
Kamala Harris slammed for not having children: 'Becoming step-parent doesn't...'
content: ​Kamala Harris has been subjected to trolling, sexist, racial slur ever since she became the vice president. Now that she is a probable in the race for the US president post, the attacks have been doubled in the last two days and she is even berated for being 'childless'. In fact, Trump's VP pick JD Vance in 2021 called Kamala Harris a childless cat lady.
summary: ​Kamala Harris has been subjected to trolling, sexist, racial slur ever since she became the vice president. Now that she is a probable in the race for the US president post, the attacks have been doubled in the last two days and she is even berated for being 'childless'. In fact, Trump's VP pick JD Vance in 2021 called Kamala Harris a childless cat lady.

title: Obama hasn't openly endorsed Kamala Harris yet because...
content: ​Former US President Barack Obama has not yet openly said anything in support of Kamala Harris -- the probable Democratic presidential nominee after Joe Biden opted out of the race. But according to a New York Times piece by Glenn Thrush, this is not a snub from Obama to Kamala, but a calculated decision -- driven by several factors.
summary: ​Former US President Barack Obama has not yet openly said anything in support of Kamala Harris -- the probable Democratic presidential nominee after Joe Biden opted out of the race. But according to a New York Times piece by Glenn Thrush, this is not a snub from Obama to Kamala, but a calculated decision -- driven by several factors.

title: 'Kamala Harris not American, partied with Epstein': 5 fake news busted
content: ​Vice president Kamala Harris finds herself at the center of a disinformation storm on social media ever since Joe Biden opted out of the presidential race paving the way for her. She will probably be the Democratic candidate against Donald Trump in the November election. ​Courtesy to the Republican campaign, claims that Kamala Harris is neither American nor Black as can't contest the US election are doing the rounds. The fact is she is a US citizen with multiracial lineage.
summary: ​Vice president Kamala Harris finds herself at the center of a disinformation storm on social media ever since Joe Biden opted out of the presidential race paving the way for her. She will probably be the Democratic candidate against Donald Trump in the November election. ​Courtesy to the Republican campaign, claims that Kamala Harris is neither American nor Black as can't contest the US election are doing the rounds. The fact is she is a US citizen with multiracial lineage.

title: Watch: Biden's phone call to Kamala Harris in raspy voice: 'I love you'
content: ​Amid Republicans storming the social media with 'where is Joe Biden' trend, Biden called Kamala Harris during a live event and said: 'I love you'. Biden has reportedly been recovering from Covid and is staying at his Rehoboth Beach home. Biden said he is not going anywhere and will be campaigning for Kamala Harris.
summary: ​Amid Republicans storming the social media with 'where is Joe Biden' trend, Biden called Kamala Harris during a live event and said: 'I love you'. Biden has reportedly been recovering from Covid and is staying at his Rehoboth Beach home. Biden said he is not going anywhere and will be campaigning for Kamala Harris.

title: Hamas and Fatah sign declaration in Beijing on ending yearslong rift
content: Hamas and Fatah have signed a significant unity declaration in Beijing aimed at ending their long-standing rift and forming a government. This move comes amid ongoing Gaza conflict and international cease-fire efforts. Despite past failures at reconciliation, the agreement signals a potential shift. The future of Gaza governance remains uncertain, with Israel and the US rejecting various proposals.
summary: Hamas and Fatah have signed a significant unity declaration in Beijing aimed at ending their long-standing rift and forming a government. This move comes amid ongoing Gaza conflict and international cease-fire efforts. Despite past failures at reconciliation, the agreement signals a potential shift. The future of Gaza governance remains uncertain, with Israel and the US rejecting various proposals.

title: King Charles 'not a monster', says former staff denying claims of his 'terrible' temper
content: A former employee defended King Charles against claims of being 'irascible,' describing him as 'absolutely not a monster in the office.' This comes after a video showed him irritated by a leaking pen. The staff member emphasised that, while he can be temperamental, he is well-prepared and respected. Meanwhile, Prince William’s focus is reportedly on his family, ignoring tensions with Harry and Meghan.
summary: A former employee defended King Charles against claims of being 'irascible,' describing him as 'absolutely not a monster in the office.' This comes after a video showed him irritated by a leaking pen. The staff member emphasised that, while he can be temperamental, he is well-prepared and respected. Meanwhile, Prince William’s focus is reportedly on his family, ignoring tensions with Harry and Meghan.

title: 'This is a good sign': Netanyahu indicates possible deal for Gaza hostages nearing
JD Vance slams Kamala Harris as ‘million times worse’ than Biden at rally
content: At a rally in Radford, Virginia, Republican vice-presidential nominee JD Vance slammed Vice President Kamala Harris, calling her “a million times worse” than President Biden. Vance criticised both parties for outsourcing jobs and emphasised a need to restore American manufacturing. Attendees voiced concerns over jobs, inflation, and Biden’s health, as heightened security was evident.
summary: At a rally in Radford, Virginia, Republican vice-presidential nominee JD Vance slammed Vice President Kamala Harris, calling her “a million times worse” than President Biden. Vance criticised both parties for outsourcing jobs and emphasised a need to restore American manufacturing. Attendees voiced concerns over jobs, inflation, and Biden’s health, as heightened security was evident.

title: 'With immense pride and ...': Harris wins key support for White House race after Pelosi endorses her
24-year-old Chinese influencer Pan Xiaoting dies during livestream Mukbang session
content: 24-year-old Chinese influencer Pan Xiaoting died during a Mukbang livestream on July 14. Known for consuming up to 10 kg of food in marathon sessions, she weighed 300 kg at the time of her death. Her extreme eating habits, despite family warnings, led to severe health issues. Her tragic death highlights the dangers of Mukbang and influencer pressures.
summary: 24-year-old Chinese influencer Pan Xiaoting died during a Mukbang livestream on July 14. Known for consuming up to 10 kg of food in marathon sessions, she weighed 300 kg at the time of her death. Her extreme eating habits, despite family warnings, led to severe health issues. Her tragic death highlights the dangers of Mukbang and influencer pressures.

title: What is DNC 2024? When is it and how do delegates work; What you need to know
content: President Joe Biden's withdrawal from the 2024 race shifts the spotlight to Vice President Kamala Harris ahead of the Democratic National Convention (DNC) on August 19-22 in Chicago. The DNC will determine the party's presidential and vice-presidential nominees through a delegate voting process, with Harris needing to secure significant support to lead the Democratic ticket.
summary: President Joe Biden's withdrawal from the 2024 race shifts the spotlight to Vice President Kamala Harris ahead of the Democratic National Convention (DNC) on August 19-22 in Chicago. The DNC will determine the party's presidential and vice-presidential nominees through a delegate voting process, with Harris needing to secure significant support to lead the Democratic ticket.

title: 'You're lucky you turned to right': Biden told Trump on call after assassination attempt
Cocaine sharks: Brazilian study shows marine predators 'high' on drug
content: Scientists discovered high levels of cocaine in Brazilian sharpnose sharks off Rio de Janeiro, raising concerns about behavioural impacts. The study found chronic exposure, with cocaine concentrations up to 100 times higher than in other marine animals. Potential sources include drug lab drainage or untreated sewage. This marks the first evidence of cocaine in free-ranging sharks, with further studies required.
summary: Scientists discovered high levels of cocaine in Brazilian sharpnose sharks off Rio de Janeiro, raising concerns about behavioural impacts. The study found chronic exposure, with cocaine concentrations up to 100 times higher than in other marine animals. Potential sources include drug lab drainage or untreated sewage. This marks the first evidence of cocaine in free-ranging sharks, with further studies required.

title: China FM says Palestinian factions agree to set up 'reconciliation government'
content: Palestinian factions including Hamas and Fatah met in Beijing this week in a renewed bid for reconciliation.
summary: Palestinian factions including Hamas and Fatah met in Beijing this week in a renewed bid for reconciliation.

title: Donald Trump describes Harris as 'bad combination' of 'vicious and dumb'
content: Donald Trump has branded Vice President Kamala Harris as 'vicious and dumb' in an interview with The Post, marking his first major comments since President Biden withdrew from the presidential race. Trump’s remarks come as Harris, the likely Democratic nominee, seeks to consolidate support. Trump’s criticisms include past controversies and Harris’s role as Biden’s 'border czar.'
summary: Donald Trump has branded Vice President Kamala Harris as 'vicious and dumb' in an interview with The Post, marking his first major comments since President Biden withdrew from the presidential race. Trump’s remarks come as Harris, the likely Democratic nominee, seeks to consolidate support. Trump’s criticisms include past controversies and Harris’s role as Biden’s 'border czar.'

title: Israeli government quietly sends millions to unauthorized West Bank settler outposts
content: Documents uncovered by Peace Now illustrate how Israel's pro-settler government has quietly poured money into the unauthorized outposts, which are separate from its more than 100 officially recognized settlements. Some of those outposts have been linked to settler violence against Palestinians and are sanctioned by the US.
summary: Documents uncovered by Peace Now illustrate how Israel's pro-settler government has quietly poured money into the unauthorized outposts, which are separate from its more than 100 officially recognized settlements. Some of those outposts have been linked to settler violence against Palestinians and are sanctioned by the US.
